author: Krishna-Vutukuri
body: This change contains Azure Compute related demo files as well associated AzureRM modules. I've run the demo script using alpha.9 release of PowerShell on Ubuntun 14.04 and Windows 10. Thank You!

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@KrishnaV-MSFT**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution!

It looks like you're a Microsoft contributor (Krishna Vutukuri). If you're full-time, we DON'T require a Contribution License Agreement. If you are a vendor, please DO sign the electronic Contribution License Agreement. It will take 2 minutes and there's no faxing! https://cla.microsoft.com.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Do we need to include the [Azure-PowerShell License](https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/blob/dev/LICENSE.txt) with the binaries?

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: Why binaries?  Can't we pull them in from somewhere?

comments.author: Krishna-Vutukuri
comments.body: @TravisEz13  @lzybkr you've raised a valid point and I agree with it. Let me explore alternatives. I could publish to PowerShellGallery but Install-Module is broken currently with -alpha.9 release. I will figure out a workaround.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Based on comments waiting on author

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @KrishnaV-MSFT - instead of a new commit, can you rewrite history so that the binary files were never introduced.  Squashing the commits should do it.

title: Adding Azure Demo and related Azure modules
